natural problem:
Find all values of $b$ for which the equations $1988x^2 + bx + 8891 = 0$ and $8891x^2 + bx + 1988 = 0$ have a common root.

Enter all the possible values of $b,$ separated by commas.
natural solution: Let $r$ be a common root, so \begin{align} 1988r^2 + br + 8891 &= 0, \\ 8891r^2 + br + 1988 &= 0. \end{align}Subtracting these equations, we get $6903r^2 - 6903 = 6903 (r^2 - 1) = 0,$ so $r = \pm 1.$ If $r = 1,$ then $1988 + b + 8891 = 0,$ so $b = \boxed{-10879}.$  If $r = -1,$ then $1988 - b + 8891 = 0,$ so $b = \boxed{10879}.$

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes b :: real and f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. f x = 1988 * x powr 2 + b * x + 8891"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. g x = 8891 * x powr 2 + b * x + 1988"
and h2 : "\<exists> x. poly (coeffs_of_poly (f x)) x = 0"
and h3 : "\<exists> x. poly (coeffs_of_poly (g x)) x = 0"
shows  "b = 10879"

 *)

assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. f x = 1988 * x powr 2 + b * x + 8891"
